translated: 3Here is the corrected and aligned text:ğŸ”½MahÄprajÃ±ÄpÄramitÄ-sÅ«tra, Scroll 84
Translated by Tripiá¹­aka Master Xuanzang on Imperial Order
Chapter 24, Part 3: Receiving the Teaching, Part 1
Such people will never discriminate the extreme joy ground dharma as empty or not empty, nor will they discriminate emptiness and non-emptiness as the extreme joy ground dharma;

They will not discriminate the spotless ground dharma, the luminous ground dharma, up to the good wisdom ground dharma, and the cloud of dharma ground dharma as empty or not empty, nor will they discriminate emptiness and non-emptiness as the spotless ground dharma, the luminous ground dharma, up to the good wisdom ground dharma, and the cloud of dharma ground dharma.

They will not discriminate the extreme joy ground dharma as having characteristics or no characteristics, nor will they discriminate having characteristics or no characteristics as the extreme joy ground dharma;

They do not discriminate the dharmas of the ground of stainlessness, the ground of luminous brilliance, up to the ground of excellent wisdom, and the ground of Dharma clouds based on characteristics and their absence, nor do they discriminate the dharmas of the ground of stainlessness, the ground of luminous brilliance, up to the ground of excellent wisdom, and the ground of Dharma clouds based on the absence of characteristics and their presence.
They do not discriminate the dharmas of the ground of joy based on aspirations and their absence, nor do they discriminate aspirations and their absence based on the dharmas of the ground of joy;

They do not discriminate the dharmas of the ground of stainlessness, the ground of luminous brilliance, up to the ground of excellent wisdom, and the ground of Dharma clouds based on aspirations and their absence, nor do they discriminate aspirations and their absence based on the dharmas of the ground of stainlessness, the ground of luminous brilliance, up to the ground of excellent wisdom, and the ground of Dharma clouds.
They do not discriminate the dharmas of the ground of joy based on arising and non-arising, nor do they discriminate arising and non-arising based on the dharmas of the ground of joy;

They do not discriminate the dharmas of the ground of freedom from defilement, the ground of luminous radiance, up to the ground of excellent wisdom, and the ground of Dharma clouds as arising or non-arising, nor do they discriminate the dharmas of arising or non-arising as the dharmas of the ground of freedom from defilement, the ground of luminous radiance, up to the ground of excellent wisdom, and the ground of Dharma clouds.
They do not discriminate the dharmas of the ground of joy as ceasing or not ceasing, nor do they discriminate ceasing or not ceasing as the dharmas of the ground of joy;

They do not discriminate the dharmas of the ground of freedom from defilement, the ground of luminous radiance, up to the ground of excellent wisdom, and the ground of Dharma clouds as ceasing or not ceasing, nor do they discriminate ceasing or not ceasing as the dharmas of the ground of freedom from defilement, the ground of luminous radiance, up to the ground of excellent wisdom, and the ground of Dharma clouds.
They do not discriminate the dharmas of the ground of joy as tranquil or not tranquil, nor do they discriminate tranquil or not tranquil as the dharmas of the ground of joy;

They do not discriminate the dharmas of the ground of stainlessness and the dharmas of the ground of blazing wisdom up to the dharmas of the ground of good wisdom and the dharmas of the cloud of Dharma as tranquil or not tranquil, nor do they discriminate the dharmas of the ground of stainlessness and the dharmas of the ground of blazing wisdom up to the dharmas of the ground of good wisdom and the dharmas of the cloud of Dharma as not tranquil or not not tranquil.

They do not discriminate the dharmas of the ground of extreme joy as separated or not separated, nor do they discriminate the dharmas of the ground of extreme joy as not separated or not not separated;

They do not discriminate the dharmas of the ground of stainlessness and the dharmas of the ground of blazing wisdom up to the dharmas of the ground of good wisdom and the dharmas of the cloud of Dharma as separated or not separated, nor do they discriminate the dharmas of the ground of stainlessness and the dharmas of the ground of blazing wisdom up to the dharmas of the ground of good wisdom and the dharmas of the cloud of Dharma as not separated or not not separated.
Such people will never discriminate the ground of birth as empty or not empty, nor will they discriminate the ground of birth as not empty or not not empty;

Do not discriminate the stages of lineage, the eighth stage, the stage of complete seeing, the stage of thin [passions], the stage of separation from desires, the stage of completion, the pratyekabuddha stage, the bodhisattva stage, and the TathÄgata stage with emptiness and non-emptiness, and also do not discriminate emptiness and non-emptiness with the stages of lineage, the eighth stage, up to the bodhisattva stage and the TathÄgata stage.
Do not discriminate the stage of different births with characteristics and no characteristics, and also do not discriminate characteristics and no characteristics with the stage of different births;

Do not discriminate the stages of lineage, the eighth stage, up to the bodhisattva stage and the TathÄgata stage with characteristics and no characteristics, and also do not discriminate characteristics and no characteristics with the stages of lineage, the eighth stage, up to the bodhisattva stage and the TathÄgata stage.
Do not discriminate the stage of different births with aspirations and no aspirations, and also do not discriminate aspirations and no aspirations with the stage of different births;ğŸ”½...

They do not distinguish the stages of the lineage, the eighth stage, up to the bodhisattva stage and the stage of the TathÄgata as having vows or being without vows, nor do they distinguish having vows or being without vows as belonging to the stages of the lineage, the eighth stage, up to the bodhisattva stage and the stage of the TathÄgata.
They do not distinguish the stage of different kinds of practices as arising or not arising, nor do they distinguish arising or not arising as belonging to the stage of different kinds of practices;

they do not distinguish the stages of the lineage, the eighth stage, up to the bodhisattva stage and the stage of the TathÄgata as arising or not arising, nor do they distinguish arising or not arising as belonging to the stages of the lineage, the eighth stage, up to the bodhisattva stage and the stage of the TathÄgata.
They do not distinguish the stage of different kinds of practices as ceasing or not ceasing, nor do they distinguish ceasing or not ceasing as belonging to the stage of different kinds of practices;

they do not distinguish the stages of the lineage, the eighth stage, up to the bodhisattva stage and the stage of the TathÄgata as ceasing or not ceasing, nor do they distinguish ceasing or not ceasing as belonging to the stages of the lineage, the eighth stage, up to the bodhisattva stage and the stage of the TathÄgata.
They do not distinguish the stage of different kinds of faith as tranquil or not tranquil, nor do they distinguish tranquil or not tranquil as the stage of different kinds of faith.

They do not distinguish the stage of lineage, the eighth stage, up to the bodhisattva stage and tathÄgata stage as tranquil or not tranquil, nor do they distinguish tranquil or not tranquil as the stage of lineage, the eighth stage, up to the bodhisattva stage and tathÄgata stage.
They do not distinguish the stage of different kinds of faith as secluded or not secluded, nor do they distinguish secluded or not secluded as the stage of different kinds of faith.

They do not distinguish the stage of lineage, the eighth stage, up to the bodhisattva stage and tathÄgata stage as secluded or not secluded, nor do they distinguish secluded or not secluded as the stage of lineage, the eighth stage, up to the bodhisattva stage and tathÄgata stage.

Such people will never distinguish the dharmas of the stage of different kinds of faith as empty or not empty, nor will they distinguish empty or not empty as the dharmas of the stage of different kinds of faith;

Do not distinguish the stage of lineage, the eighth stage, up to the bodhisattva stage and the stage of the TathÄgata in terms of emptiness and non-emptiness, and also do not distinguish emptiness and non-emptiness in terms of the stage of lineage, the eighth stage, up to the bodhisattva stage and the stage of the TathÄgata.

Do not distinguish the stage of different kinds of lands in terms of having characteristics and being without characteristics, and also do not distinguish having characteristics and being without characteristics in terms of the stage of different kinds of lands;

Do not distinguish the stage of lineage, the eighth stage, up to the bodhisattva stage and the stage of the TathÄgata in terms of having characteristics and being without characteristics, and also do not distinguish having characteristics and being without characteristics in terms of the stage of lineage, the eighth stage, up to the bodhisattva stage and the stage of the TathÄgata.

Do not distinguish the stage of different kinds of lands in terms of having aspirations and being without aspirations, and also do not distinguish having aspirations and being without aspirations in terms of the stage of different kinds of lands;

They do not distinguish the stages of the lineage, the eighth stage, up to the bodhisattva stage and the stage of the TathÄgata in terms of having vows or being without vows, nor do they distinguish having vows or being without vows in terms of the stages of the lineage, the eighth stage, up to the bodhisattva stage and the stage of the TathÄgata.
They do not distinguish the stage of different kinds of lands in terms of arising or non-arising, nor do they distinguish arising or non-arising in terms of the stage of different kinds of lands;

They do not distinguish the stages of the lineage, the eighth stage, up to the bodhisattva stage and the stage of the TathÄgata in terms of arising or non-arising, nor do they distinguish arising or non-arising in terms of the stages of the lineage, the eighth stage, up to the bodhisattva stage and the stage of the TathÄgata.
They do not distinguish the stage of different kinds of lands in terms of ceasing or not ceasing, nor do they distinguish ceasing or not ceasing in terms of the stage of different kinds of lands;

They do not discriminate the stages of the lineage, the eighth stage, up to the bodhisattva stage and tathÄgata stage as ceased or not ceased, nor do they discriminate the stages of cessation and non-cessation as the stages of the lineage, the eighth stage, up to the bodhisattva stage and tathÄgata stage.
They do not discriminate the stages of the different lands as tranquil or not tranquil, nor do they discriminate tranquility or non-tranquility as the stages of the different lands;

they do not discriminate the stages of the lineage, the eighth stage, up to the bodhisattva stage and tathÄgata stage as tranquil or not tranquil, nor do they discriminate tranquility or non-tranquility as the stages of the lineage, the eighth stage, up to the bodhisattva stage and tathÄgata stage.
They do not discriminate the stages of the different lands as separated or not separated, nor do they discriminate separation or non-separation as the stages of the different lands;ğŸ”½...

They do not discriminate the stages of the lineage, the eighth stage, up to the bodhisattva stage and tathÄgata stage as being far or near, nor do they discriminate the stages of being far or near as being the stages of the lineage, the eighth stage, up to the bodhisattva stage and tathÄgata stage.
Such people will never discriminate the realm of conditioned phenomena as being empty or not empty, nor will they discriminate emptiness or non-emptiness as being the realm of conditioned phenomena;
They will not discriminate the realm of unconditioned phenomena as being empty or not empty, nor will they discriminate emptiness or non-emptiness as being the realm of unconditioned phenomena.

They will not discriminate the realm of conditioned phenomena as having characteristics or being without characteristics, nor will they discriminate having characteristics or being without characteristics as being the realm of conditioned phenomena;

They will not discriminate the realm of unconditioned phenomena as having characteristics or being without characteristics, nor will they discriminate having characteristics or being without characteristics as being the realm of unconditioned phenomena.

They will not discriminate the realm of conditioned phenomena as having aspirations or being without aspirations, nor will they discriminate having aspirations or being without aspirations as being the realm of conditioned phenomena;

One should not discriminate the unconditioned realm as having vows or being vowless, nor should one discriminate having vows or being vowless as the unconditioned realm.ğŸ”½One should not discriminate the conditioned realm as arising or non-arising, nor should one discriminate arising or non-arising as the conditioned realm;
One should not discriminate the unconditioned realm as arising or non-arising, nor should one discriminate arising or non-arising as the unconditioned realm.
One should not discriminate the conditioned realm as ceasing or not ceasing, nor should one discriminate ceasing or not ceasing as the conditioned realm;

One should not discriminate the unconditioned realm as ceasing or not ceasing, nor should one discriminate ceasing or not ceasing as the unconditioned realm.ğŸ”½One should not discriminate the conditioned realm as tranquil or not tranquil, nor should one discriminate tranquil or not tranquil as the conditioned realm;
One should not discriminate the unconditioned realm as tranquil or not tranquil, nor should one discriminate tranquil or not tranquil as the unconditioned realm.
Do not discriminate the conditioned realm as either far or near, and also do not discriminate far and near as the conditioned realm;
Do not discriminate the unconditioned realm as either far or near, and also do not discriminate far and near as the unconditioned realm.
At that time, SubhÅ«ti said to the gods,

Thus, this profound, difficult to see, difficult to realize, inconceivable, beyond conceptual thought, subtle, tranquil, supreme, only realized internally by the most holy ones, not measurable by the wise and intelligent of the world, prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, there is truly no one who can believe and accept it.
Why is it so?
Because in this there is no dharma that can be revealed or demonstrated. Because there is no dharma that can be revealed, truly there is no one who can believe and accept it.
At that time, ÅšÄriputra asked SubhÅ«ti, saying:
Isn't it the case that in this profound teaching of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, the three vehicles are extensively explained, namely the teachings of the Å›rÄvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and the supreme vehicle?
It extensively explains the acceptance of bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas from their initial generation of the mind up to the ten grounds, the bodhisattva path,
namely the pÄramitÄ of giving, morality, patience, diligence,
dhyÄna, and prajÃ±Ä, as well as inner emptiness, outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness,
emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, emptiness of the conditioned, emptiness of the unconditioned,

absolute emptiness, endless emptiness, emptiness of dispersion, emptiness of unchanging, emptiness of inherent nature, emptiness of specific characteristics, emptiness of common characteristics, emptiness of all dharmas, emptiness of non-attainment, emptiness of nature,
emptiness of self-nature, emptiness of the nature of non-existence, suchness, dharma realm, dharma nature,
non-deceptive nature, unchanging nature, equality nature, nature of separation from birth,
dharmas, definite dharmas, abiding in dharmas, reality, space element, inconceivable element, if the noble truth of suffering,
the noble truths of the accumulation, cessation, and path, if the four meditations, four immeasurables, four
formless concentrations, if the eight liberations, eight spheres of mastery, nine successive concentrations, ten
pervading the [four] bases, if the four establishments of mindfulness, four right efforts, four bases of supernatural power, five faculties, five strengths,
seven factors of enlightenment, eightfold noble path, if the gate of liberation of emptiness, signlessness,
wishlessness, if the five eyes, six supernormal knowledges, if the ten powers of the Buddha, four
fearlessnesses, four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity,
eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha, if the quality of non-forgetfulness, constant relinquishment, if
all-knowledge, knowledge of path aspects, and knowledge of all aspects, as well as all dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways
and all samÄdhi gateways?

Explaining in detail the excellent qualities of embracing bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, namely, because bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas diligently practice this prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, wherever they are born they always receive

a birth by transformation, in unimpeded spiritual powers they are able to play freely, from one buddha land they proceed to one buddha land, making offerings to and respectfully revering the World-Honored Buddhas, according to their aspirations

they are able to cultivate and quickly perfect various wholesome roots, in the presence of the Buddhas they hear and uphold the true Dharma up to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, they are able to not forget or neglect it,
always dwelling in excellent samÄdhi, apart from a distracted mind, by this as a condition they attain unobstructed eloquence, uninterrupted
eloquence, unerring eloquence, swift eloquence, appropriate eloquence, and whatever they expound is abundant in meaning
the eloquence of taste, and the most wonderful and supreme eloquence in all worlds?
Subhuti replied:ğŸ”½It is so!
It is so!
It is just as you have said.
In this profound teaching of prajnaparamita, the Dharma of the three vehicles is extensively explained, namely the Dharma of the sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and the supreme vehicle;
The path of the bodhisattva-mahasattva is extensively explained and accepted, starting from the initial generation of the mind up to the tenth ground, namely the paramita of giving and all samadhis;

The excellent qualities and events of the bodhisattva-mahasattva are extensively explained and accepted, namely because the bodhisattva-mahasattva diligently practices this prajnaparamita, wherever they are born they always receive transformation birth, up to attaining the most wonderful and supreme eloquence in all worlds. In this profound teaching, all that is said is done with the skillful means of non-attainment.
Sariputra said:
What dharmas are taken as skillful means by not attaining anything?
SubhÅ«ti said:
ÅšÄriputra!
This takes the self as skillful means by not attaining anything;

this takes sentient beings, living beings, born beings, nourished beings, persons, individuals, mind-born beings, young beings, doers, experiencers, knowers, and seers as skillful means by not attaining anything.
ÅšÄriputra!
This takes form as skillful means by not attaining anything;
this takes feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness as skillful means by not attaining anything.
ÅšÄriputra!
This takes the eye sense base as skillful means by not attaining anything;
this takes the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense bases as skillful means by not attaining anything.
ÅšÄriputra!
This takes the form sense base as skillful means by not attaining anything;
This, with regard to the sense fields of sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental objects, is the skillful means of non-apprehension.
ÅšÄriputra!
This, with regard to the eye element, is the skillful means of non-apprehension;
This, with regard to the form element, eye consciousness element, eye contact, and the feelings produced from the condition of eye contact, is the skillful means of non-apprehension.
ÅšÄriputra!
This, with regard to the ear element, is the skillful means of non-apprehension;
This, with regard to the sound element, ear consciousness element, ear contact, and the feelings produced from the condition of ear contact, is the skillful means of non-apprehension.
ÅšÄriputra!
This, with regard to the nose element, is the skillful means of non-apprehension;
This, with regard to the smell element, nose consciousness element, nose contact, and the feelings produced from the condition of nose contact, is the skillful means of non-apprehension.
ÅšÄriputra!
This, with regard to the tongue element, is the skillful means of non-apprehension;
This is to use non-apprehension as the method regarding the taste element, tongue consciousness element, tongue contact, and the feelings produced from the condition of tongue contact.
ÅšÄriputra!
This is to use non-apprehension as the method regarding the body element;
This is to use non-apprehension as the method regarding the touch element, body consciousness element, body contact, and the feelings produced from the condition of body contact.
ÅšÄriputra!
This is to use non-apprehension as the method regarding the mind element;
This is to use non-apprehension as the method regarding the dharma element, mind consciousness element, mind contact, and the feelings produced from the condition of mind contact.
ÅšÄriputra!
This is to use non-apprehension as the method regarding the earth element;
This is to use non-apprehension as the method regarding the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements.
ÅšÄriputra!
This is the method of non-apprehension with regard to the noble truth of suffering;
This is the method of non-apprehension with regard to the noble truths of the arising, cessation, and path [of suffering].
ÅšÄriputra!
This is the method of non-apprehension with regard to ignorance;

This is the method of non-apprehension with regard to volitional actions, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress.
ÅšÄriputra!
This is the method of non-apprehension with regard to internal emptiness;

This, with regard to external emptiness, internal and external emptiness, emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, emptiness of conditioned phenomena, emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, absolute emptiness, emptiness without beginning or end, emptiness of non-dispersal, emptiness of inherent existence, emptiness of specific characteristics, emptiness of general characteristics, emptiness of all phenomena, emptiness of non-apprehension, emptiness of nature, emptiness of intrinsic nature, and emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence, is by means of non-apprehension.
ÅšÄriputra!
This, with regard to suchness, is by means of non-apprehension;

This, with regard to the dharma realm, dharma nature, non-false nature, unchanging nature, equality nature, nature of non-arising, dharma determination, dharma abiding, reality limit, space realm, and inconceivable realm, is by means of non-apprehension.
ÅšÄriputra!
This, with regard to the perfection of generosity, is by means of non-apprehension;
This is the skillful means of the perfection of morality, patience, diligence, concentration, and wisdom, using non-apprehension.
ÅšÄriputra!ğŸ”½This is the skillful means of the four meditations,
this is the skillful means of the four immeasurable [minds] and four formless concentrations, using non-apprehension.
ÅšÄriputra!
This is the skillful means of the eight liberations, using non-apprehension;
this is the skillful means of the eight superior [spheres of] perception, nine successive [meditations], and ten universal bases, using non-apprehension.
ÅšÄriputra!
This is the skillful means of the four establishments of mindfulness, using non-apprehension;
this is the skillful means of the four right efforts, four bases of supernatural power, five faculties, five powers, seven factors of enlightenment, and eightfold noble path, using non-apprehension.
ÅšÄriputra!
This, with regard to the gate of liberation of emptiness, is the skillful means of non-apprehension;
This, with regard to the gates of liberation of signlessness and wishlessness, is the skillful means of non-apprehension.
ÅšÄriputra!
This, with regard to the five eyes, is the skillful means of non-apprehension;
This, with regard to the six supernormal knowledges, is the skillful means of non-apprehension.
ÅšÄriputra!
This, with regard to the ten powers of the Buddha, is the skillful means of non-apprehension;

This, with regard to the four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, and the eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha, is the skillful means of non-apprehension.
ÅšÄriputra!
This, with regard to the Dharma of non-forgetfulness, is the skillful means of non-apprehension;
This, with regard to the nature of constant relinquishment, is the skillful means of non-apprehension.
ÅšÄriputra!
This, with regard to all dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways, is the skillful means of non-apprehension;
This, with regard to all samÄdhi gateways, is the skillful means of non-apprehension.
ÅšÄriputra!
This, with regard to omniscience, is the skillful means of non-apprehension;
This, with regard to the cognition of the path and the cognition of all aspects, is the skillful means of non-apprehension.
ÅšÄriputra!
This, with regard to the ÅšrÄvaka Vehicle, is the skillful means of non-apprehension;
This, with regard to the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle and the unsurpassed vehicle, is the skillful means of non-apprehension.
ÅšÄriputra!
This, with regard to the stream-enterer, is the skillful means of non-apprehension;
This, with regard to the once-returner, non-returner, and arhat, is the skillful means of non-apprehension.
ÅšÄriputra!
This, with regard to the path of the stream-enterer and the fruit of stream-entry, is the skillful means of non-apprehension;

This is the approach of non-apprehension for the path of the once-returner and the fruit of the once-returner, for the path of the non-returner and the fruit of the non-returner, and for the path of the arhat and the fruit of the arhat.
ÅšÄriputra!
This is the approach of non-apprehension for the pratyekabuddha;
This is the approach of non-apprehension for the path of the pratyekabuddha and the fruit of the pratyekabuddha.
ÅšÄriputra!
This is the approach of non-apprehension for the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;
This is the approach of non-apprehension for the samyak-saá¹ƒbuddha.
ÅšÄriputra!
This is the approach of non-apprehension for the Dharma of the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;
This is the approach of non-apprehension for the Dharma of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.
ÅšÄriputra!
This is the approach of non-apprehension for the ground of joy;

This, in the ground of freedom from defilements, the ground of radiant light, the ground of blazing wisdom, the ground of utmost difficulty conquering, the ground of manifest presence, the ground of far-reaching, the ground of immovable, the ground of excellent wisdom, and the ground of Dharma clouds, is done through the skillful means of non-apprehension.
ÅšÄriputra!
This, in the dharmas of the ground of extreme joy, is done through the skillful means of non-apprehension;

This, in the dharmas of the ground of freedom from defilements, the dharmas of the ground of radiant light, the dharmas of the ground of blazing wisdom, the dharmas of the ground of utmost difficulty conquering, the dharmas of the ground of manifest presence, the dharmas of the ground of far-reaching, the dharmas of the ground of immovable, the dharmas of the ground of excellent wisdom, and the dharmas of the ground of Dharma clouds, is done through the skillful means of non-apprehension.
ÅšÄriputra!
This, in the ground of different lineages, is done through the skillful means of non-apprehension;

This, in the ground of lineage, the eighth ground, the ground of complete seeing, the ground of thinness, the ground of separation from desire, the ground of accomplishment, the ground of pratyekabuddhas, the ground of bodhisattvas, and the ground of tathÄgatas, is done through the skillful means of non-apprehension.
ÅšÄriputra!
This is the Dharma of the stage of different dispositions, using non-apprehension as a skillful means;

This is the Dharma of the stage of lineage, the eighth stage, the stage of fully seeing, the stage of thinning out defilements, the stage of separation from desire, the stage of completion, the pratyekabuddha stage, the bodhisattva stage, and the TathÄgata stage, using non-apprehension as a skillful means.
ÅšÄriputra!ğŸ”½This is the conditioned realm, using non-apprehension as a skillful means;
This is the unconditioned realm, using non-apprehension as a skillful means.
Then ÅšÄriputra asked SubhÅ«ti, saying:

For what reason, in this profound teaching of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, using non-apprehension as a skillful means, are the three vehicles extensively taught, namely the vehicles of the Å›rÄvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and the unsurpassed vehicle?

For what causes and conditions, in this profound teaching of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, using non-attainment as the skillful means, does it extensively explain the acceptance and embracing of bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas from their initial generation of the mind of enlightenment up to the ten grounds, the bodhisattva path, namely the perfection of giving and so forth, and all the doors of samÄdhi?

For what causes and conditions, in this profound teaching of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, using non-attainment as the skillful means, does it extensively explain the acceptance and embracing of the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas' excellent qualities and events, namely that because bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas diligently practice this prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, wherever they are born they always receive a transformed birth, up to attaining the most wonderful and excellent eloquence in all worlds?
SubhÅ«ti replied:
ÅšÄriputra!

Because of inner emptiness, in this profound teaching of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, using non-apprehension as a skillful means, the three vehicles are extensively taught, namely the teachings of the Å›rÄvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and the supreme vehicle.
ÅšÄriputra!

Because of outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, emptiness of conditioned phenomena, emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, absolute emptiness, emptiness without beginning or end, emptiness of dispersion, emptiness of inherent existence, emptiness of specific characteristics, emptiness of common characteristics, emptiness of all phenomena, emptiness of non-apprehension, emptiness of nature, emptiness of intrinsic nature, and emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence, in this profound teaching of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, using non-apprehension as a skillful means, the three vehicles are extensively taught, namely the teachings of the Å›rÄvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and the supreme vehicle.
ÅšÄriputra!
Because of inner emptiness, in this profound teaching of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, using non-apprehension as a skillful means,
The obtained is used as a skillful means, extensively explaining the acceptance of bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas from their initial generation of the mind
up to the ten grounds and the bodhisattva path, namely the perfection of giving, the perfection of morality,
the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence, the perfection of meditation, and the perfection of wisdom, whether it be the emptiness of the internal,
the emptiness of the external, the emptiness of the internal and external, the emptiness of emptiness, the great emptiness, the emptiness of the ultimate, the emptiness of the conditioned,
the emptiness of the unconditioned, the emptiness of the absolute, the emptiness of the beginningless and endless, the emptiness of dispersion, the emptiness of the unchanging,

as the skillful means, it extensively explains the acceptance and embracing of the excellent matters of merit of bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas
, namely, because bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas diligently practice this prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ,
wherever they are born, they always receive the birth of transformation, and in the spiritual powers that do not regress, they are able to play freely
, going from one buddha land to another buddha land, making offerings, paying respects, venerating, and praising the buddhas,
The World-Honored Buddha, according to one's wishes and inclinations, is able to cultivate various wholesome roots and quickly perfect them.
Having heard and upheld the true Dharma from the buddhas up to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, one is able to
not forget it and also not be lazy or negligent. One always abides in supreme concentration, free from a distracted mind. Based on this as a condition,
one attains unobstructed eloquence, inexhaustible eloquence, unerring eloquence, swift eloquence, appropriate eloquence,
and eloquence that is rich in meaning and flavor, the most wonderful and supreme eloquence in all worlds.

Celestial Heavens, YÄma Heaven, Tuá¹£ita Heaven, NirmÄá¹‡arati Heaven, ParanirmitavaÅ›avartin Heaven, BrahmakÄyika Heaven, Brahmapurohita Heaven, BrahmapÄrá¹£adya Heaven, MahÄbrahmÄ Heaven, Ä€bhÄsvara Heaven, ParÄ«ttÄbha Heaven, ApramÄá¹‡Äbha Heaven, Ä€bhÄsvara Heaven, Åšubha Heaven, ParÄ«ttaÅ›ubha Heaven, ApramÄá¹‡aÅ›ubha Heaven, Åšubhaká¹›tsna Heaven, Bá¹›hatphala Heaven, Avá¹›ha Heaven, Atapa Heaven, SudarÅ›ana Heaven, and Akaniá¹£á¹­ha Heaven, all had this thought:

Now, Venerable SubhÅ«ti, empowered by the Buddha's spiritual power, is raining down the great Dharma rain for all sentient beings. We should now each transform into various wonderful celestial flowers to offer to ÅšÄkyamuni TathÄgata, the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, the bhiká¹£u saá¹…gha, and Venerable SubhÅ«ti, and also scatter them over the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ that is being expounded, in order to make offerings.
When the celestial hosts had this thought, they each transformed into various subtle and wonderful incense and flowers, and offered them to the TathÄgata, the bodhisattvas, and the others.

At that time, in this world system of a billion worlds, the flowers completely filled the air and, by the Buddha's spiritual power, combined to form a flower pavilion, adorned with extraordinary wonders, covering the entire world system of a billion worlds.
The Venerable SubhÅ«ti, having witnessed this event, had this thought:

The flowers scattered now, which have never been seen in the heavens, are extraordinarily wonderful. They are definitely not born from grass, trees, water, or land. They must be the flowers that the gods have transformed from their minds in order to make offerings.
At that time, Åšakra, Lord of the Devas, knowing what SubhÅ«ti was thinking, said to SubhÅ«ti:
These scattered flowers are truly not born from grass, trees, water, or land, nor are they transformed from the mind. They are merely manifestations.
The Venerable SubhÅ«ti said to Åšakra, Lord of the Devas:
If these flowers are unborn, then they are not flowers.
At that time, Åšakra, Lord of the Devas, asked SubhÅ«ti:
Are only these flowers unborn, or are other dharmas also like this?
SubhÅ«ti replied:
Not only are these flowers unborn, but other dharmas are also like this.
What does this mean?
KauÅ›ika!
Form is also unborn. Since it is unborn, it is not form;
feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness are also non-arising. Since these are non-arising, they are not feeling, perception, mental formations, or consciousness.
Why is it so?
Because non-arising dharmas are free from all conceptual proliferation, and cannot be established as form, etc.
KauÅ›ika!
The eye sense base is also non-arising. Since it is non-arising, it is not the eye sense base;
the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense bases are also non-arising. Since they are non-arising, they are not the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind sense bases.
Why is it so?
Because non-arising dharmas are free from all conceptual proliferation, and cannot be established as the eye sense base, etc.
KauÅ›ika!
The form sense base is also non-arising. Since it is non-arising, it is not the form sense base;
the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma sense bases are also non-arising. Since they are non-arising, they are not the sound, smell, taste, touch, or dharma sense bases.
Why is it so?
Because the unborn nature is free from all conceptual proliferation and cannot be designated as the sense field of form, etc.
KauÅ›ika!
The eye sense field is also unborn. Since it is unborn, it is not the eye sense field;

The form sense field, eye consciousness sense field, eye contact, and the various feelings that arise from eye contact as a condition are also unborn. Since they are unborn, they are not the form sense field up to the various feelings that arise from eye contact as a condition.
Why is it so?
Because the unborn nature is free from all conceptual proliferation and cannot be designated as the eye sense field, etc.
KauÅ›ika!
The ear sense field is also unborn. Since it is unborn, it is not the ear sense field;
